surrogate.load¶

surrogate.load.load(data_folder='test')[source]¶

Load data from all HDF5 files in the results folder and return as numpy arrays.

surrogate.model¶

class surrogate.model.DeepONet(branch, trunk, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

build(input_shape)[source]¶
call(inputs, return_branch=False, return_trunk=False)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • mu – batch of parameters (dimension: B x p)

  • x – batch of spatial points (tensor whose last dimension is d)

classmethod from_config(config)[source]¶

Creates an operation from its config.

This method is the reverse of get_config, capable of instantiating the same operation from the config dictionary.

Note: If you override this method, you might receive a serialized dtype config, which is a dict. You can deserialize it as follows:

```python if “dtype” in config and isinstance(config[“dtype”], dict):

policy = dtype_policies.deserialize(config[“dtype”])

```

Parameters:

config – A Python dictionary, typically the output of get_config.

Returns:

An operation instance.

get_config()[source]¶

Returns the config of the object.

An object config is a Python dictionary (serializable) containing the information needed to re-instantiate it.

plot_training_history()[source]¶

Plots the training and validation loss over epochs. This method should be called after training the model using train_model.

Return type:

None

train_model(X, mu, y, X_val, mu_val, y_val, learning_rate=0.001, epochs=10000, batch_size=15000, loss='mean_squared_error', validation_freq=1, verbose=0, lr_scheduler=None, metrics=['mse'], clipnorm=None, early_stopping_patience=None, log=False, optimizer='adam')[source]¶

Trains the model on the provided dataset. Use “tensorboard –logdir logs” to visualize logs (if log is set to True).

Return type:

None

class surrogate.model.DenseNetwork(normalization_layer=True, input_neurons=1, n_neurons=None, activation='tanh', output_neurons=1, output_activation='linear', initializer='glorot_uniform', l1_coeff=0, l2_coeff=0, batch_normalization=False, dropout=False, dropout_rate=0.3, leaky_relu_alpha=None, layer_normalization=False, positional_encoding_frequencies=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

A class to build, train, and manage a neural network model using TensorFlow and Keras.

adapt(X)[source]¶
build(input_shape)[source]¶

Builds the model layers based on the input shape. Called automatically when the model is first used.
